member.name: NETINFOSTRUCT
member.summary: TheNETINFOSTRUCT structure contains information describing the network provider returned by the function.

member.name: NETINFOSTRUCT.cbStructure
member.summary: The size, in bytes, of theNETINFOSTRUCT structure. The caller must supply this value to indicate the size of the structure passed in. Upon return, it has the size of the structure filled in.

member.name: NETINFOSTRUCT.dwProviderVersion
member.summary: The version number of the network provider software.

summary.para: The current status of the network provider software. This member can be one of the following values.

listheader.description: The network is not currently able to service requests, but it should become available shortly. (This value typically indicates that the network is starting up.)

summary.para: Characteristics of the network provider software.
Windows Me/98/95: This member can be one or more of the following values.

listheader.description: The network provider is running as a 16-bit Windows network driver.
The network provider requires a redirected local disk drive device to access server file systems.
The network provider requires a redirected local printer port to access server file systems.

member.name: NETINFOSTRUCT.dwHandle
member.summary: An instance handle for the network provider or for the 16-bit Windows network driver.

member.name: NETINFOSTRUCT.wNetType
member.summary: The network type unique to the running network. This value associates resources with a specific network when the resources are persistent or stored in links. You can find a complete list of network types in the header file Winnetwk.h.

summary.para: A set of bit flags indicating the valid print numbers for redirecting local printer devices, with the low-order bit corresponding to LPT1.
Windows Me/98/95: This value is always set to –1.
A set of bit flags indicating the valid local disk devices for redirecting disk drives, with the low-order bit corresponding to A:.
Windows Me/98/95: This value is always set to –1.
